article_text: The U.S. Department of Labor has sent proposed revisions in national overtime regulations to the White House that could increase the number of workers for whom time-and-a-half pay is mandated. The proposed changes, expected to be published soon, would be the first overhaul of wage-and-hour law since 2004.

article_metadata.news-keywords: overtime, labor law, wage and hour, obama

article_metadata.title: Wage law changes would make more managers eligible for overtime pay | The Kansas City Star
